instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - works but doesnt charge, blinks once green light on MG port
threads.message:
MG port voltage 16.6V

plugged in starts fluctuating between 2 and 12V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0.25V

Please advice how to proceed. Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - works but doesnt charge, blinks once green light on MG port
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0.25V"
How does this board work then???

Please post accurate information.
Specify when you measure with charger alone, or battery alone; as when charger only connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - works but doesnt charge, blinks once green light on MG port
threads.message:
Sorry for confusion.

When battery is connected the Machine works but doesn't charge.

With charger only i get this:

MG port voltage 16.6V unplugged

plugged - starts fluctuating between 2 and 12V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0.25V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - works but doesnt charge, blinks once green light on MG port
threads.message:
"MG port voltage 16.6V unplugged

plugged - starts fluctuating between 2 and 12V"
Not very clear this...
Unplugged what?
Do you get 16V without charger???

Possibly leakage on input stage.
Check <DIODE>D7010</DIODE> and post exact ohm value for <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>; measured onboard.
If good, change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - works but doesnt charge, blinks once green light on MG port
threads.message:
<DIODE>D7010</DIODE> looks good.
<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> shows 68K Ohms
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and voila, it works again!
Thanks for your help!
